intro: Cuphea remotifolia, commonly known as the remoteleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often visited by hummingbirds and bees, making it a valuable addition to pollinator gardens. Cuphea remotifolia prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, thriving in warm, tropical climates.
